content: Your account has been successfully deactivated. In 10 seconds you will be redirected to the <1>site</1>.

comment.text: This translation key displays a message confirming account deactivation and provides information about the redirect to another site after 10 seconds. It is used in a UI confirmation page where the user's account has been successfully deactivated.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag `<1>site</1>` is not properly localized or translated. It should ideally be adapted to the Arabic context (e.g., 'ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàŸÇÿπ').
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace `<1>site</1>` with `<1>ÿßŸÑŸÖŸàŸÇÿπ</1> or a more contextually relevant Arabic term for 'site'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are correctly preserved in the Czech translation, mirroring the English content.
The HTML tags `<1>` and `</1>` are inconsistent between the English and Lao translations. The English uses `<1>` and `</1>` while the Lao uses `<1>` and `</1>`.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure consistent HTML tag usage.  The Lao translation should use `<1>` and `</1>` to match the English.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The tag `<1>` is present in both the English and Polish versions, indicating it's likely a placeholder and should be handled consistently.  It's important to ensure this tag is replaced with the appropriate value in the final implementation.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Verify the intended use of the `<1>` tag and ensure it is replaced with the correct value in the final implementation.  If intended to be HTML, ensure it's properly escaped.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala translation uses a Sinhala numeral 'ëá™' instead of the Arabic numeral '10'. This may confuse users familiar with Arabic numerals and is inconsistent with common practice for numbers.
The tags <1> and </1> are inconsistent between the English and Slovak versions. The English uses <1> while the Slovak uses an arbitrary tag.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Ensure the tags used for dynamic content are consistent between the source and target language (e.g., both use <1> and </1>).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English text states 'deactivated', but the Slovenian translation uses 'ponovno aktiviran' which means 'reactivated'. This is a significant translation error.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Va≈° raƒçun je bil uspe≈°no deaktiviran. ƒåez 10 sekund boste preusmerjeni na <1>stran</1>.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The HTML tags <1> and </1> seem unusual and likely unintentional.  They are likely meant to signify a variable or placeholder.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Review the original English content's HTML tags to ensure correct representation in the Vietnamese translation. They are probably not needed.
